page.title: 07STURRY (cont)
page.content: On either side of Island Road, which is an old Roman Road, there are 3 ancient burial grounds i.e. Roman, Anglo-Saxon and Iron Age. There are rumours of the ghost of a headless Roman Soldier said to wander round the Convent and the old burial grounds. Also at the Swan Public House in the village there is supposed to be a ghost of a smuggler who was arrested on the premises and hung in Canterbury. A popular Kentish pastime is "bat and trap" which is played in the public house gardens. Another pastime is a shooting range, owned by "Greenfield and son", situated on Sturry Hill. It is one of the five clay pigeon ranges in Kent and so attracts people from a large area. People nearby complain of the noise.
